question: Which of the following organelle is NOT part of an animal cell?
Cells with more mitochondria have more...?
One of the follow is NOT a function of the cell wall?
The endoplasmic recticulum has two sections. What are these two sections called?
What is the word use to describe the process that occurs in the mitochondria to generate energy?
What is the difference between active transport and diffusion?

answers.a: Diffusion is passive movement of particles from a higher concentration and lower concentration, active transport is diffusion of water across a membrane
answers.b: Diffusion passively moves substances against the concentration gradient, Active transport uses energy to move substances with the concentration gradient.
answers.c: Diffusion is when energy is used to move substances against the concentration gradient, Active transport uses energy to move substances with the concentration gradient.
answers.d: Diffusion passively moves substances with the concentration, Active transport uses energy to move substances against the concentration gradient

question: Would a sperm cell, a cell that requires a lot of energy, have a lot of mitochondria?

answers.a: Yes, a sperm cell would need a lot of mitochondria
answers.b: No, a sperm would only need a few mitochondria
